com.apriori.concurrent.atoms

Interface Atom<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the atom's value
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SynchronousAtom<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsynchronousAtom, SimpleAtom, ThreadLocalAtom, TransactionalAtom

    public interface Atom<T>
    A thread-safe reference type. Common to all atoms are the ability to retrieve its current value and to add "watchers", which are called back when the atom's value changes. Atoms also support mutations, to change the atom's current value. However, mutation methods are defined on sub-types since there are basically two mutually exclusive types of mutation:
    • Synchronous: Mutation events are made immediately, in the current thread. When a synchronous mutation method has returned, the change has been made and watchers have been notified.
    • Asynchronous: Mutation events are queued immediately but may execute at some point in the future, in a different thread. Asynchronous mutations return futures that are completed when the changes have been made and watchers have been notified.
    See Also:
    SynchronousAtom, AsynchronousAtomTest

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Atom.Watcher<T>
      Watches an atom for changes to its value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addWatcher(Atom.Watcher<? super T> watcher)
      Registers a watcher, which will receive notifications when the atom's value changes.
      T get()
      Retrieves the current value for this atom.
      boolean removeWatcher(Atom.Watcher<? super T> watcher)
      Unregisters a watcher.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get()
        Retrieves the current value for this atom.
        Returns:
        the current value for the atom

      • addWatcher

        boolean addWatcher(Atom.Watcher<? super T> watcher)
        Registers a watcher, which will receive notifications when the atom's value changes.
        Parameters:
        watcher - the watcher
        Returns:
        true if the watcher was registered; false if no change occurred because the watcher was already registered

      • removeWatcher

        boolean removeWatcher(Atom.Watcher<? super T> watcher)
        Unregisters a watcher.
        Parameters:
        watcher - the watcher
        Returns:
        true if the watcher was unregistered; false if no change occurred because the watcher was never registered to begin with
